page.title: 05SMEATHARPE -RICH IN FLORA
page.content: Smeatharpe and its surrounding country -side has an abundance of wild flowers and trees. This is mainly because of the network of narrow, country lanes bounded by many miles of high hedgerows, peculiar to Devon. Among the wild flowers are: primrose, daffodil, dandelion, red campion, cow parsley, clovers, meadowsweet, fox- glove, willow herb, and ferns. The hedgerows are made up of hawthorn,dog rose, blackberry, honey- suckle, ash, oak, sycamore and holly. In the cultivated gardens are: crocus, snowdrop, daffodil, wallflower, tulip, aubretia, pansy, paeony, sweet pea, rose, dahlia, antirrhinum, chrysanth- emum, Michaelmas daisy. The main shrubs are forsythia, lilac, honey- suckle and fuschia. Delicate plants cannot usually survive because of the high winds.
